com.ba.robolib.Wheels

Class TankDrive

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ba.robolib.Wheels.TankDrive

  • public class TankDrive
extends java.lang.Object
    Class holding methods to run a robot drive system in tank mode.

    • Method Detail

      • mapWheels

        public void mapWheels(com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.HardwareMap hardwareMap,
                      java.lang.String rightFrontMotor,
                      java.lang.String rightBackMotor,
                      java.lang.String leftFrontMotor,
                      java.lang.String leftBackMotor)
        Maps 4 motors to the software. Necessary to use all other methods.
        Parameters:
        hardwareMap - A hardware map that will be populated with all 4 wheels
        rightFrontMotor - The name of the motor, as specified in the config, positioned on the right front side as viewed from the top of the robot.
        leftFrontMotor - The name of the motor, as specified in the config, positioned on the left front side as viewed from the top of the robot.
        rightBackMotor - The name of the motor, as specified in the config, positioned on the right back side as viewed from the top of the robot.
        leftBackMotor - The name of the motor, as specified in the config, positioned on the left back side as viewed from the top of the robot.

      • mapWheels

        public void mapWheels(com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.HardwareMap hardwareMap,
                      java.lang.String rightMotor,
                      java.lang.String leftMotor)
        Maps 2 motors to the software. Necessary to use all other methods.
        Parameters:
        hardwareMap - A hardware map that will be populated with all 4 wheels
        rightMotor - The name of the motor, as specified in the config, positioned on the right side as viewed from the top of the robot.
        leftMotor - The name of the motor, as specified in the config, positioned on the left side as viewed from the top of the robot.

      • setDirections

        public void setDirections()
        Sets wheel directions

      • moveWheels

        public void moveWheels(double power)
        Moves all wheels in the same direction
        Parameters:
        power - The absolute motor power

      • moveWheels

        public void moveWheels(double power,
                       java.lang.String wheelGroup)
        Turns the robot about its center point
        Parameters:
        power - The absolute motor power
        wheelGroup - A string describing which direction to turn.

      • stopWheels

        public void stopWheels()
        Stops all 4 wheels of the robot
